metadata.description: Daily market breadth indicators for S&P 500 constituents
metadata.calculation_note: All metrics calculated using previous close as baseline

field_descriptions.date: Trading date for the breadth data (YYYY-MM-DD)
field_descriptions.advances: Number of stocks that closed higher than previous close
field_descriptions.declines: Number of stocks that closed lower than previous close
field_descriptions.unchanged: Number of stocks with no price change
field_descriptions.advance_decline_ratio: Ratio of advancing to declining stocks (advances/declines)
field_descriptions.advancing_volume: Total volume of stocks that advanced
field_descriptions.declining_volume: Total volume of stocks that declined
field_descriptions.volume_ratio: Ratio of advancing volume to declining volume
field_descriptions.stocks_near_52w_high: Number of stocks within 1% of their 52-week high
field_descriptions.stocks_near_52w_low: Number of stocks within 1% of their 52-week low
field_descriptions.above_20_day_ma: Number and percentage of stocks trading above their 20-day moving average
field_descriptions.above_50_day_ma: Number and percentage of stocks trading above their 50-day moving average
field_descriptions.above_200_day_ma: Number and percentage of stocks trading above their 200-day moving average

advances_declines.interpretation: Advances > Declines suggests broad market strength

volume_metrics.interpretation: Volume ratio > 1 means more volume in advancing stocks (bullish)

new_highs_lows.threshold_note: Near high: within 1%, Near low: within 1%
new_highs_lows.interpretation: More new highs than lows indicates strong market leadership

above_20_day_ma.interpretation: >70% = strong short-term trend, <30% = weak short-term trend
